title: Comprensión de Lectura 2 - Consejos para Estudiantes
description: Ejercicio de comprensión lectora que integra estructuras de obligación, consejos, deducciones modales, adjetivos descriptivos y expresiones comunes.

questions.question: Read the following advice column for students and answer the questions:
readingText: I'm writing because I'm having huge problems with my studies. I'm absolutely starving for information about effective study techniques, but I don't know where to start. My grades are terrible, and I look confused most of the time in class. My expression must show how lost I feel!

I'd rather study alone than in groups because I find group work distracting. However, my study advisor says I must join study groups to improve my understanding. She also told me I'd better make a study schedule or I'll fall behind even more. But honestly, I can't concentrate for more than 30 minutes at a time.

I need to do something about my situation urgently. My parents are furious about my poor performance, and they might withdraw their financial support. The thought of losing their help is absolutely terrifying! I must find a way to turn things around quickly.

What advice can you give me? I need some guidance on time management and study strategies. Should I hold on to my preference for studying alone, or should I force myself to join groups? I'm desperate for any information that might help.

Your situation sounds challenging, but you needn't panic - there are many ways to improve your academic performance. First, you don't have to choose between solo and group study. You could try both methods and see what works best for different subjects.

You'd better start with small, manageable goals. Instead of studying for hours, you might break your sessions into 25-minute chunks with short breaks. This technique could help you maintain concentration. You must also make sure you're getting enough sleep - tired students can't learn effectively.

Regarding your parents' concerns, you should have an honest conversation with them. They must understand that improvement takes time. Your expression of worry shows you care about your education, which is a positive sign. You just need to chill out and develop better study habits gradually.
Remember, asking for help isn't a sign of weakness - it shows wisdom. Your teachers and advisors are there to support you, so don't hesitate to reach out when you need assistance.
Best wishes for your academic success!
